Tipu Muslihat Samuel L. Jackson di 'The Banker'
05 Nov 2019, 11:45 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Samuel L. Jackson berperan dalam film yang diangkat dari kisah nyata, bertajuk 'The Banker'. (Kevin Winter/Getty Images for Turner Sports/AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Aktor Samuel L. Jackson dan Anthony Mackie berperan dalam filmÂ The Banker yang diangkat dari kisah nyata. Ia akan beradu akting dengan , Nicholas Hoult, Nia Long, Jessie T. Usher dan Colm Meaney.The Banker mengangkat cerita yang terfokus pada revolusi yang dilakukan oleh seorang pebisnis bernama Bernard Garrett (Anthony Mackie) dan Joe Morris (Samuel L. Jackson). Mereka mengembangkan rencana berani yang secara tersirat menyatakan penolakan terhadap rasisme yang terjadi pada tahun 1960-an.Rencana tersebut adalah melatih seorang buruh berkulit putih bernama Matt (diperankan oleh Nicholas Hoult) untuk berdandan seperti orang kaya saat itu, sehingga mendapatkan sejumlah hak istimewa yang membantu bisnis perumahan dan perbankan mereka berkembang. Sementara, Garrett dan Morris menyamar jadi pesuruh dan sopir si buruh.Sukses mereka lantas menarik perhatian pemerintah federal, hingga segala yang telah dibangun terancam dihancurkan.Dalam trailer, terlihat Garrett tengah berusaha membujuk Morris supaya setuju membeli sebuah bank. "Memiliki sebuah bank itu seperti memiliki sisi lain dalam bisnis perumahan," kata Garrett, yang langsung diingatkan Morris bahwa mereka berdua sama-sama berkulit hitam.Meskipun rekan-rekannya skeptis, Garrett bersikeras melanjutkan rencana itu dengan dukungan sang istri Eunice (Nia Long).



Garrett pula yang meyakinkan Matt untuk menjadi 'wajah' bisnis. Ketika Matt mengakui bahwa ia tak tahu apapun soal perbankan, Garrett dan Morris bertindak sebagai pelindung dengan mengajarkan segala hal yang perlu ia tahu seperti bermain golf dan cara berbicara kepada 'rekan kulit putih yang kaya raya'.George Nolfi duduk di kursi sutradara film ini, dengan naskah ditulis oleh Niceole Levy, David Lewis Smith dan Stan Younger. The Banker akan tayang di bioskop pada awal Desember mendatang, sebelum debut di Apple TV+ pada Januari 2020. (rea)

Samuel L. Jackson's Deception in 'The Banker'
05 Nov 2019, 11:45 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Samuel L. Jackson played a role in the film based on a true story, titled 'The Banker'. (Kevin Winter / Getty Images for Turner Sports / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Actors Samuel L. Jackson and Anthony Mackie played a role in the film The Banker based on a true story. He will compete acting with, Nicholas Hoult, Nia Long, Jessie T. Usher and Colm Meaney. The Banker raised the story focused on the revolution carried out by a businessman named Bernard Garrett (Anthony Mackie) and Joe Morris (Samuel L. Jackson). They developed a bold plan that implied a rejection of racism that occurred in the 1960s. The plan was to train a white laborer named Matt (played by Nicholas Hoult) to dress up like a rich man at the time, so as to obtain a number of privileges that helped their housing and banking business is growing. Meanwhile, Garrett and Morris disguised themselves as the messenger and driver of the worker. Their success then attracted the attention of the federal government, until everything that had been built was threatened to be destroyed. In the trailer, it was seen Garrett was trying to persuade Morris to agree to buy a bank. "Having a bank is like having another side to the housing business," said Garrett, who was immediately reminded by Morris that they were both black. Although his colleagues were skeptical, Garrett insisted on continuing the plan with the support of his wife Eunice (Nia Long) .



Garrett also convinced Matt to be the 'face' of the business. When Matt admitted that he knew nothing about banking, Garrett and Morris acted as protectors by teaching everything he needed to know such as playing golf and how to talk to 'wealthy white colleagues'. George Nolfi sat in the director's chair in this film, with manuscripts written by Niceole Levy, David Lewis Smith and Stan Younger. The Banker will appear in theaters in early December, before debuting on Apple TV + in January 2020. (rea)
